reviewText: This is the poorest quality made film. I wish I never bought it. It would also be nice if the producer of the film acknowledges before someone purchases this that Quentin Tarantino produced The Protector which is the same film but of super high quality. I stopped watching Tom yum goong 5 minutes into it because it is so pathetic.

A successful legal sex-business of respectful citizens was eventually for some time disrupted with revelations of illegal prostitution deployed resulted from a damage of property and a public disorder a third world elephant-boy caused arriving in Australia to free with his amazing marshal skills (much more dramatic ones than demonstrated on a ring in Beautiful Boxer) his elephants stolen from Thailand and smuggled into Australia to meet dietary inclinations for species protected of citizens mentioned above. It is really fun to watch Australia through eyes of one of the most Oz-friendly nation Thailand usually is while for moviemakers an elephant walking along Sydney's streets was as much a normal event as, one could conclude, at that time a plentitude of Asia-related policepersons at different levels of responsibilities in the Australian law-enforcement. Probably, it might somehow explain lacking of both thirty minute screen time in The Protector and subtitles accompanying most of Thai-speaking scenes.
